current_collaborators: Andy Watkins, Jamie Unwin, Kieran Topping, Tom Price Stephens
description:
Hi all, Domenico in particular,

Where there is more than one community with a particular name, we told
them apart by looking at the first 4 significant figures of the
community latitude.
We then gave them our own name, as follows (in json format):

var disamb = {
    "Newport,50.70": "Newport, Isle of Wight",
    "Newport,52.78": "Newport, Shropshire",
    "Newport,51.59": "Newport, Gwent",
    "Newport,52.02": "Newport, Pembrokeshire",
    "Newport,51.98": "Newport, Essex",

    "Preston,53.77": "Preston, Lancashire",
    "Preston,50.65": "Preston, Dorset",

    "Hatfield,51.76": "Hatfield, Hertfordshire",
    "Hatfield,53.58": "Hatfield, Yorkshire",

    "Bangor,53.22": "Bangor, Gwynedd",
    "Bangor,54.65": "Bangor, County Down"
};

At one stage it LOOKED like there were also duplicate communities of
"Bristol" and "Plymouth". This turned out not to be the case - it was
just that they had incorrect latitude data.

Of course, we have always had the regions->communities lookup table
but unfortunately this was of little help, as the region data doesn't
appear in the Torchbearers export.

The London Boroughs' short names are looked up using the following
lookup (this time it's a php array! apologies - as you can see this
mapping has been refined in a very organic fashion!).

static $communityMap = array(
  "The City of London" => "City",
  "The City of Westminster" => "Westminster",
  "The London Borough of Barnet" => "Barnet",
  "The London Borough of Bexley" => "Bexley",
  "The London Borough of Brent" => "Brent",
  "The London Borough of Bromley" => "Bromley",
  "The London Borough of Camden" => "Camden",
  "The London Borough of Croydon" => "Croydon",
  "The London Borough of Ealing" => "Ealing",
  "The London Borough of Enfield" => "Enfield",
  "The London Borough of Hackney" => "Hackney",
  "The London Borough of Hammersmith & Fulham" => "Hammersmith & Fulham",
  "The London Borough of Haringey" => "Haringey",
  "The London Borough of Harrow" => "Harrow",
  "The London Borough of Havering" => "Havering",
  "The London Borough of Hillingdon" => "Hillingdon",
  "The London Borough of Hounslow" => "Hounslow",
  "The London Borough of Islington" => "Islington",
  "The London Borough of Lambeth" => "Lambeth",
  "The London Borough of Lewisham" => "Lewisham",
  "The London Borough of Merton" => "Merton Borough",
  "The London Borough of Newham" => "Newham",
  "The London Borough of Redbridge" => "Redbridge",
  "The London Borough of Richmond upon Thames" => "Richmond upon Thames",
  "The London Borough of Southwark" => "Southwark",
  "The London Borough of Sutton" => "Sutton",
  "The London Borough of Tower Hamlets" => "Tower Hamlets",
  "The London Borough of Waltham Forest" => "Waltham Forest",
  "The London Borough of Wandsworth" => "Wandsworth",
  "The Royal Borough of Greenwich" => "Greenwich",
  "The Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea" => "Kensington & Chelsea",
  "The Royal Borough of Kingston Upon Thames" => "Kingston"
);

I am happy to clarify anything that needs clarifying!

Kind regards,

Kieran





On Tue, Apr 17, 2012 at 1:43 PM, Jamie Unwin <jamie@kitsite.com> wrote:
> Hi Andy,
>
> Kieran did indeed make some mapping rules based on (amongst other things) "communityName+lattitude" (in order to deal with non-uniqueness of some communities ie. 3 newports) -> Region
>
> It's not quite as simples as a 1-1 mapping and we don't have it in a nice ready to go format (ie. a text file) although Kieran is trying to compile it into something approaching that for you guys today.
>
> ps. not quite sure what Danny supplied to Domenico, as as far as Kieran and I are aware we don't have a "ready to go" mapping file, maybe it was the mappings we sketched out when we were trying determine the edge cases.
>
> Jamie
>
> On 17 Apr 2012, at 13:24, Andy Watkins wrote:
>
>> Hi Jamie,
>>
>> Nope, not getting confused. The torchbearer lookup/search functionality allows us to search for torchbearers by first selecting a region and then a community. As the torchbearer feed we receive doesn't include region, you guys figure this out for us - I suspect using the same data you use in the 'locations by region and date' section.
>>
>> Danny was previously in discussion with Domenico about how this is achieved and I think provided him the mappings you've used. If this is easily accessible it might be useful to share the latest mapping with Domenico.
>>
>> Hope that makes sense!
>>
>> Andy
>>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:jamie@kitsite.com]
>> Sent: 17 April 2012 10:47
>> To: Andy Watkins
>> Cc: Domenico Ventura; Kavita Kapoor; Liz Goulding; Kieran Topping
>> Subject: Re: Torch Bearers and communities
>>
>> Hi Andy,
>>
>> I am wondering if the two different areas of Torch search functionality, and their associated (but separate) feed files are getting confused here:
>>
>> 1) The Torchbearer lookup
>> http://www.london2012.com/olympic-torch-relay-torchbearers
>>
>> This is a more complex search (which also includes the individual torchbearers) however it excludes the breakdown by cities, towns and village (covered by "Where is the flame going" below)
>>
>> I am not sure the exact format you supply this data to us in, Kieran do you an example of the last file that we were supplied (however it is not the same format as jamiemaster100112.xlsx)
>>
>> 2) Where is the flame going (
>> http://www.london2012.com/games/olympic-torch-relay/where-is-the-olympic-flame-going/locations-by-region-and-date.php
>>
>> This is concerned only with dates and cities, towns and village broken down by region (it does not show/contain the torchbearers themselves) and uses the [ jamiemaster100112.xlsx ] file which is in the following format:
>>
>> Town,Date,Nation or Region,Community order,Url,Visit Type
>> Land's End,"Saturday, May 19, 2012",South West,1,lands-end,
>> Sennen,"Saturday, May 19, 2012",South West,2,,
>> Newlyn,"Saturday, May 19, 2012",South West,3,,
>>
>> The url refers to the filename of the page, if a page exists for that town (ie. http://www.london2012.com/games/olympic-torch-relay/where-is-the-olympic-flame-going/lands-end.php)
>>
>> Jamie
>>
>> On 16 Apr 2012, at 17:49, Andy Watkins wrote:
>>
>> > Hi Domenico,
>> >
>> > The file attached should contain all the community values you will receive in the torchbearer file. We had all sorts of fun with the torch team updating these in the source system and breaking the TB search functionality, so in the end I created a macro to maintain the values the Kitsite team were expecting to receive. I'll keep this up to date so you shouldn't have to deal with any further changes.
>> >
>> > I'm not sure if the mapping of communities to regions changed during this process so it might be safest to get an updated file. Jamie, could you help out here please? (I think Kieran probably has the mapping details if you don't.)
>> >
>> > Regarding the London communities, you'll receive them as per the file attached. If you can you should display them as-is, but in the Kitsite implementation we found that the long names were breaking dropdowns and page layout, so we introduced short names. These are used on the search and results page, but not on the TB details page.
>> >
>> > e.g. Search uses 'Bexley' - http://www.london2012.com/games/olympic-torch-relay/torchbearers/search.php?bearer-location=london&community=Bexley&search-submit=Go - detail page uses 'The London Borough of Bexley' - http://www.london2012.com/games/olympic-torch-relay/torchbearers/detail/C529-2A80-B21D-B94B.
>> >
>> > Thanks,
>> > Andy
>> >
>> >
>> > From: Domenico Ventura [mailto:Domenico.Ventura@deltatre.com]
>> > Sent: 15 April 2012 17:33
>> > To: Andy Watkins; Kavita Kapoor
>> > Cc: Liz Goulding
>> > Subject: Torch Bearers and communities
>> >
>> > Hi all,
>> >
>> > We've received some time ago in the task 16150, excel named jamiemaster100112.xlsx, the list of communities and regions of the OTR. With the new export of torchbearers, some communities are not matching anymore. For example no community matches the London region.
>> > I've discovered this is because the relay communities in the new export have every different names. For example for region London, the jamiemaster excel has the following communities:
>> >
>> > Croydon
>> > Kingston
>> > Olympic Stadium
>> > Camden
>> > Richmond
>> > Harrow
>> > Merton
>> > Islington
>> > Southwark
>> > Westminster
>> > Waltham Forest
>> > Wandsworth
>> > Redbridge
>> > City
>> > Enfield
>> > Hammersmith & Fulham
>> > Lewisham
>> > Hackney
>> > Greenwich
>> > Bexley
>> > Brent
>> > Sutton
>> > Kensington & Chelsea
>> > Hounslow
>> > Lambeth
>> > Bromley
>> > Barking & Dagenham
>> > Barnet
>> > Tower Hamlets
>> > Havering
>> > Hillingdon
>> > Ealing
>> > Haringey
>> > Newham
>> >
>> > While for example in the torch bearers data we have:
>> > The London Borough of Croydon
>> > The Royal Borough of Kingston Upon Thames
>> > The London Borough of Camden
>> >
>> > And so on.
>> >
>> > Questions:
>> >
>> > - Can we get an updated version of the community data? Or is there any additional way to match the relay community in the torchbearer data with the region?
>> > Which name should be displayed for the relay community? I see the current website shows Camden, not "The London Borough of Camden"
>> >
>> >
>> > Thanks ciao domenico

description:
Hi Danny,

Not sure if you're the right person to get in touch with, but I'm having issues with CMS.  I'm trying to set up a new page, but it keeps coming up with an error screen, saying the page has already been created.

I had created a page with the same name earlier in the day, but then deleted it. Now even variations of the name won't work.  Can you help at all? Need to get this page set up urgently.

If it's easier to chat my number is 02032012349

Thanks,
Kat

Hi Anne,

When you say delay are you talking about a ~15min delay or a much longer delay ie. a day

If it's a ~15min delay is completely normal, as publication is set to run every 5 mins and then the pages need to sync across all the different front end servers, which can take another 5 to 10 mins.

But if your seeing a much longer delay could you explain your workflow, ie. the steps you are taking?

ps. last wee we did have an issue with publication, as Ia BT firewall chnage had blocked access from our CMS server to the live servers (so nothign was begin published), although that was resolved last week.

Jamie
Anne - how long is the delay? Is it just 10 minutes or so? Or longer?

Hi Jamie,
We have created the stories in the folder News/French. Should we only create them in News article without specifying French?
Thanks.
Anne

Thanks Anne,

- Do you have a url of a problem page
- When you create the page in News/French and publish it do you see the story on the new index page (in preview mode) / what does the page say does it just say "In progress" or "Published"?

I am wondering if what you are seeing is simply the index page not begin updated, normally the translation workflow causes the French news index and French home page to be republished, but if you create a page manually this won't happen and you'll have to re-publish those pages yourself.

Jamie

Hello Jamie,

My name is Mayra, from Anne’s team. I am the one who put the article on CMS so I will try to explain all the steps I followed before it was published (all articles in this folder appear as published).

I created an article in the fr/news/2012/04 folder. As we were said, the type of the article is “news article fr” so I set that type for the article. We published another article last week with the same settings.
Unfortunately, both articles seem to be hidden somewhere and they do not appear on the French News section of the website, right after another article, even if the url works separately. So it seems there is no url problem.

We noticed also that the only article that appears on the index page was not the same type, that is, “news article” and not “news article fr”. We tried to republish the last article with the “news article” type but it seems it is not the problem.

You might be right on the second idea you pointed out but how can we make it automatically and update the French index ?

Thank you very much

Mayra

description:
I've published three news items today but my dashboard says it cannot be loaded. I republished them again to make sure but the same message appears. Could you kindly take a look at it, please? 

Another issue is the Mayor's Office logo which does not appear in the supported by Section. Please see this link http://festival.london2012.com/events/9000961518

Staging server: We can access this but we cannot see the event's we've previously uploaded.



Many thanks.
subject: news items cannot be loaded, Mayor's logo and staging server

comments.value:
I've published three news items today but my dashboard says it cannot be loaded. I republished them again to make sure but the same message appears. Could you kindly take a look at it, please? 

Another issue is the Mayor's Office logo which does not appear in the supported by Section. Please see this link http://festival.london2012.com/events/9000961518

Staging server: We can access this but we cannot see the event's we've previously uploaded.



Many thanks.

Hello,
Can you let us know which "news items" you have tried to publish please?
Also, could you send a screenshot of the error message please?
Many thanks,
Kieran

Hi this is the error message and the screenshot of the news. I need to publish (Damon albarn’s dr dee, The music of George Benjamin and Handspring Crow

[cid:image001.jpg@01CD1892.A1D3DA40]

[cid:image002.jpg@01CD1892.A1D3DA40]
Could you also please take a look at the staging server? Our producers would like to see the event pages before they become live.

Tuesday,
We have noticed a technical problem with one of the servers that the CMS publishes content to. These servers are beyond our control. The london2012 systems team have been advised, and I will contact you when they have fixed the problem.
Kieran

Hi Kieran

Does it mean both the staging server and the news articles are affected because of this technical issue?

Tuesday

Could you let me know who you flagged this to so I could follow up as well?

Tuesday

Basically, because of a firewall rule that [somebody] implemented
overnight, we cannot publish content out of the CMS. This means that no
content can reach the staging server at the moment which - consequently -
means that no content can reach the live website.
We are waiting (as are you!) for the issue to be resolved.
Kieran
Any news about this?

Hi,
The three news items that you published should now be visible on the website.
For example:
  http://festival.london2012.com/news/2012/04/damon-albarn-s-dr-dee-at-eno.php

Regarding the images here:
  http://festival.london2012.com/events/9000961518
There seems to be a general problem regarding the images served by GDP. For example:
  http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/venueImages/images/tn2/305722.jpg

Am CC-ing Wahome, and will also contact GDP.

Kieran

Thanks Kieran. So CMS is now fully working and I can now make updates?

Tuesday

Yes.
Kind regards,
Kieran

Mayors logo is now appearing on events
http://festival.london2012.com/events/9000961518

Thanks a lot Jamie and Kieran! Sorry to be such a pain today.

Tuesday

Time: Kieran 0.2
Jamie: 0.1 ??

Any update on the staging website? Sorry for bombarding you with emails. We are currently uploading 500 events on the event database and some producers would like to see their events before they go live.

Many thanks

Tuesday

Tuesday, as far as we can see, everything is functioning as it it should.
However, if you're saying that some events aren't appearing in the search when they /should/, could you send us the id of an event that SHOULD be appearing but ISN'T, and we can double-check in the feed (and the GDP search results)
Kieran
Kieran: +.1

Hi again

Here are just some of the events that are not appearing on the staging server


1. ELD Dancing Voices

2. ELD Havering Big Dance Weekend

3. ELD Hidden Gems

4. ELD I love dance Hackney festival

5. ELD One Giant Leap

6. Sparks

7. Watch this step

The field ‘excluded from feed’ has been ticked in these events as instruction from the events database team so they won’t be live.

Tuesday

I'm afraid that if the "exclude from feed" button is ticked then it means that events won't even make it into the Kitsite CMS, let alone on to the staging/production environment.

We simply collect a feed from GDP every 10 mins and push the events onto the festival website. If it's not in the feed then it won't go onto the website (or, presumably, for that matter, appear in the GDP search results, although it's not my area of expertise)

The copy and images should be checked and approved using the GDP database tools. Once they're marked for inclusion in the feed, they will appear on the website!

If you could ask GDP for a new "tick box" to say "Put into the feed BUT don't include in the search results" then that might achieve the behaviour you're requesting?

Unless, of course, there is some GDP staging server that I don't know about?

Kieran

Hi Tuesday,

Re. "update on the staging website"

By "staging website" do you really mean "why haven't the events we entered in GDP appeared on the festival site, has the feed broken?"

WE have checked the feed and we have received no events with "ELD", "Emoto" or "Watch this step" in the title.
http://festival.london2012.com/events/9000961969

We did find an entry for "Sparks" but this (if it is the same event) is live.
http://festival.london2012.com/events/9000961969

Neither are the events coming back from the GDP search (I am using the event "ELD" as an example)
http://festival.london2012.com/events/search.php?categoryIds=&searchString= ELD&searchLocation=Town+or+Postcode&startDate=From+Date&endDate=To+Date&event-search-submit=Find+Events

This would seem to suggest the problem is simply that we have not been sent the events form GDP / that GDP havent' made these events live in their system.

The staging server 'syncs' automatically to the live site festival.london2012.com every 5 mins, there is no significant delay (other than that 5mins) or notion of approval between the staging and live servers. In fact there is nothing special or different between the staging and live servers other than the staging server can only be certain by certain IP addresses. The only reason for the staging server is so we can stop syncing and test out significant changes to the site or to the server configuration files. But this is not something we do on a normal day to day basis. In fact there is no way to show events only on the staging server as GDP will need to out the event live so that it will appear in their search API and in turn in our search results.

Can I just check that you aren't doing something in the GDP system that would stop the events being sent to us in the feed and/or appearing in GDP's search results API ?

thanks

Jamie

"The field ‘excluded from feed’ has been ticked in these events as instruction from the events database team so they won’t be live."

Ah, that would explain the problem...

That checkbox is doing *exactly* what it says, namely ‘exclud(ing the event) from (the) feed’ which is why we wont' have received it / it won't be appearing on the festival site (staging or live).

* I should reiterate, despite it's name, there is nothing special about the "staging server" it does not (without manual intervention) give you the ability to 'stage' or 'preview' an event or page prior to it going live. Furthermore in the case of event pages (as opposed to template or config changes) there is no way of staging an event page, as the very notion of sending it to us from GDP will cause the event to simultaneously appear in the live GDP search results.

** is there no method in GDP's system of previewing an event before it is sent to us? that would the natural/sensible place to preview an event.
Thanks, apparently last November events appeared on the staging website without being live.. I will ask around first how they did and get back to you.
Thanks, apparently last November events appeared on the staging website without being live.. I will ask around first how they did and get back to you.

Hi Jamie

Many thanks for this information. I was just told by the Wahome that the staging website was used when the Festival website was not yet live which was why they could preview events. From what I know, there is no way to preview an event thru GDP. Many thanks again for your help.

Best regards,

Tuesday
Costs are a mix of setting up new logos and resolving staging issues (due to BT)

From: Andy Watkins <Andy.Watkins@london2012.com>

We are going to change our browser support statement to state that,
while we make best endeavours to support IE6, it’s not always
possible. This helps us with the map, where Earthware have been
investing a lot of additional effort just for IE6.

A quick question for you – would you be able to display a message in
place of the map if you detected the user was using IE6?

This can come out of the retainer pot as we'll need to use the same on
the replacement map, which we hope to launch in the next few weeks.
subject: IE6 Message on all Earthware maps

comments.value:
From: Andy Watkins <Andy.Watkins@london2012.com>

We are going to change our browser support statement to state that,
while we make best endeavours to support IE6, it’s not always
possible. This helps us with the map, where Earthware have been

This can come out of the retainer pot as we'll need to use the same on
the replacement map, which we hope to launch in the next few weeks.
Marking as high.
Awaiting feedback on the text for the message and where on the page it should appear.

Danny,

Text should read as follows:

It looks like you’re using an old version of Internet Explorer that is unable to display this content. We suggest you update your browser to make full use of the features available on our website.

This should be displayed prominently in place of the map (i.e. hide the map if the message is displayed). I’m not sure if we have a precedent for displaying these messages elsewhere – if not, I’m happy for you to suggest a good way of making the message noticeable.

Cheers,
Andy

Cheers
Lars

description:
From: Andy Watkins <Andy.Watkins@london2012.com>

Next week (once the torch announcement is behind us) we need to create
a page in the test folder for the replacement map. It should use the
same template as the Stamen map – Jon at Earthware can provide the
script reference, which we need to be editable, as for the torch map.
subject: New map page

comments.value:
From: Andy Watkins <Andy.Watkins@london2012.com>

Next week (once the torch announcement is behind us) we need to create
a page in the test folder for the replacement map. It should use the
same template as the Stamen map – Jon at Earthware can provide the
script reference, which we need to be editable, as for the torch map.

The current map: http://www.london2012.com/map.php
Example of an Earthware map: http://www.london2012.com/olympic-torch-relay-map

Andy, have you got any more details of what is required or should we get in touch with Jon at Earthware?

No more detail than I’ve given below. Jon should be able to provide exact width (which I think is the same as the Stamen map) and script reference for testing.

Thanks,
Andy
Emailed Jon.

From Jon: It's very similar to the torch map - we'll need a script reference in the head section to Microsoft's Bing Maps API, the reference to our script as far down the page as possible, and a couple of lines of HTML in the appropriate place. If you want to start getting it ready here's what you can add now: 1. Bing Maps API reference (Add to the HEAD section of the page) 2. HTML (add this at the point the map should appear)
It wouldn't hurt to add this CSS to your stylesheet as well: #eventsmapcontainer { width: 880px; height: 660px; } It's not mandatory, but should avoid the odd effect we get on the torch map page at the moment, where the content gets visibly pushed down once the map loads in. I'll get you the script reference to add at the bottom of the page later - hopefully it will be ready in the next few hours.

I've created a new template using the above code:
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/test/map.php

More from Jon:

Our script reference for embedding in the page is:

<script type="text/javascript" src="http://mapping-stage.london2012.com/eventsmap-develop-staging-3/steal.production.js?." language="javascript"></script>

As I mentioned, this needs to go as far down the page as you can manage - we've had issues in the past when it's too high up.

The bit in the "src" attribute is what needs to be made content manageable.

Please could you let me have the link when you have your test page up, then I can make sure things are working as expected - the main issue we've had in the past has been styling conflicts where we pick up additional styles from your stylesheets which cause our stuff to look odd.
Published to: http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/test/map.php

From Jon:

I notice that you’re using the jQuery UI date picker on the new torchbearer search page that you’ve built. Is there any chance you could give me a copy of the images and custom styling you’re using for this? It will save me some time in styling the one we’re using on the replacement map as I can just make some colour tweaks to yours rather than starting from scratch.
Jon, the date picker assets were delivered to us by cogapp. You can probably identify what you need by inspection, but if you need any clarification, please do get back in touch.
Attached is the Datepickers css and a couple of images it refers to.
Script reference isn't editable. Could we introduce this today please - it should be like the torch map.
Done.
Added to March retainer.
